subject.name: NSW HSC Physics
subject.description: Core physics curriculum for students in years 11-12 (16-18 years old)

working_scientifically_skills.name: Questioning and Predicting
working_scientifically_skills.description: Developing and evaluating questions and hypotheses for scientific investigation
key_actions: Modify questions based on new evidence

working_scientifically_skills.name: Planning Investigations
working_scientifically_skills.description: Designing and evaluating investigations to obtain data and information

working_scientifically_skills.name: Conducting Investigations
working_scientifically_skills.description: Conducting investigations to collect valid and reliable data

working_scientifically_skills.name: Processing Data and Information
working_scientifically_skills.description: Processing appropriate data and information using various media

working_scientifically_skills.name: Analyzing Data and Information
working_scientifically_skills.description: Analyzing and evaluating primary and secondary data and information

working_scientifically_skills.name: Problem Solving
working_scientifically_skills.description: Solving scientific problems using data, critical thinking and scientific processes
key_actions: Apply scientific principles to novel situations

working_scientifically_skills.name: Communicating
working_scientifically_skills.description: Communicating scientific understanding using suitable language and terminology

mathematical_skills.name: Vector Mathematics
mathematical_skills.description: Representation and manipulation of vector quantities
misconceptions: Treating all physical quantities as scalars
Neglecting direction in calculations
key_concepts: Resolution into components (Fx = Fcosθ, Fy = Fsinθ)

mathematical_skills.name: Algebraic Manipulation
mathematical_skills.description: Rearranging equations and solving for unknown variables
misconceptions: Applying incorrect operations to both sides of equations

mathematical_skills.name: Graphical Analysis
mathematical_skills.description: Interpreting and creating graphs of physical relationships
misconceptions: Confusing the graph with the physical situation
key_concepts: Interpreting slopes and areas under curves

mathematical_skills.name: Calculus Application
mathematical_skills.description: Using derivatives and integrals in physics contexts
misconceptions: Not understanding the physical meaning of derivatives and integrals

mathematical_skills.name: Dimensional Analysis
mathematical_skills.description: Analyzing and validating equations using dimensions and units
misconceptions: Ignoring units in calculations
key_concepts: Checking equation validity through dimensional analysis

mathematical_skills.name: Error Analysis
mathematical_skills.description: Evaluating uncertainty in measurements and calculations
misconceptions: Confusing accuracy with precision

year11_modules.name: Module 1: Kinematics
year11_modules.description: Study of motion without considering forces

concepts.name: Uniform Straight-Line Motion
concepts.description: Motion with constant velocity
misconceptions: Confusing distance with displacement

concepts.name: Uniformly Accelerated Motion
concepts.description: Motion with constant acceleration
misconceptions: Confusing instantaneous and average values
practical_investigations: Analyze acceleration using ticker timers or motion sensors

concepts.name: Scalar vs. Vector Quantities
concepts.description: Distinguishing between quantities with and without direction
misconceptions: Treating all quantities as scalars

concepts.name: Vector Analysis
concepts.description: Analyzing motion in two dimensions
misconceptions: Failing to account for direction

concepts.name: Relative Motion
concepts.description: Motion of objects relative to different reference frames
misconceptions: Confusing absolute and relative motion

year11_modules.name: Module 2: Dynamics
year11_modules.description: Study of forces and their effects on motion

concepts.name: Types of Forces
concepts.description: Contact and field-mediated forces
misconceptions: Thinking 'force' is a property of an object

concepts.name: Net Force and Equilibrium
concepts.description: Vector sum of forces and balanced force conditions
misconceptions: Ignoring force components

concepts.name: Force Pairs
concepts.description: Action-reaction force pairs (Newton's Third Law)
misconceptions: Confusing force pairs with balanced forces

concepts.name: Newton's First Law
concepts.description: Objects maintain state of rest or uniform motion unless acted upon by net force
misconceptions: Thinking moving objects naturally stop

concepts.name: Newton's Second Law
concepts.description: Force causes acceleration proportional to mass
practical_investigations: Verify proportionality between force and acceleration
misconceptions: Ignoring vector nature of the equation

concepts.name: Friction
concepts.description: Force opposing relative motion between surfaces
misconceptions: Thinking friction always opposes motion direction

concepts.name: Work and Energy
concepts.description: Transfer of energy through application of force over displacement
misconceptions: Confusing work and force

concepts.name: Mechanical Power
concepts.description: Rate of energy transfer or work done
misconceptions: Confusing power with energy or force

concepts.name: Linear Momentum
concepts.description: Product of mass and velocity of an object
misconceptions: Treating momentum as a scalar

concepts.name: Conservation of Momentum
concepts.description: Total momentum in a closed system remains constant
misconceptions: Applying to systems with external forces

concepts.name: Impulse
concepts.description: Change in momentum caused by force applied over time
misconceptions: Confusing impulse with momentum

concepts.name: Elastic and Inelastic Collisions
concepts.description: Collisions with/without conservation of kinetic energy
practical_investigations: Compare momentum and energy in different collisions
misconceptions: Thinking all collisions conserve kinetic energy

year11_modules.name: Module 3: Waves and Thermodynamics
year11_modules.description: Study of wave phenomena and heat transfer

concepts.name: Wave Characteristics
concepts.description: Fundamental properties common to all waves
misconceptions: Confusing wavelength and amplitude

concepts.name: Wave Types
concepts.description: Classification of waves by medium and vibration direction
practical_investigations: Generate different wave types with springs/slinkies
misconceptions: Thinking all waves require a medium

concepts.name: Wave Energy Transfer
concepts.description: Process of energy movement without matter transfer
practical_investigations: Energy transfer in wave tank or ripple tank
misconceptions: Thinking waves transfer matter

concepts.name: Reflection
concepts.description: Change in wave direction from a boundary
practical_investigations: Reflection of waves in ripple tank
misconceptions: Incorrect understanding of angle relationships

concepts.name: Refraction
concepts.description: Change in wave direction due to speed change
practical_investigations: Refraction in ripple tank with depth change
misconceptions: Confusing with reflection

concepts.name: Diffraction
concepts.description: Bending of waves around obstacles or through openings
misconceptions: Thinking only small obstacles cause diffraction

concepts.name: Superposition and Interference
concepts.description: Combination of waves to form resultant wave
practical_investigations: Two-source interference patterns in ripple tank
misconceptions: Thinking waves destroy each other in destructive interference

concepts.name: Standing Waves
concepts.description: Fixed pattern formed by superposition of identical waves
misconceptions: Thinking standing waves transfer energy along the medium

concepts.name: Resonance
concepts.description: Maximum amplitude response at natural frequency
misconceptions: Thinking all frequencies cause strong vibrations

concepts.name: Sound Properties
concepts.description: Characteristics specific to sound waves
practical_investigations: Relate pitch and loudness to wave characteristics
misconceptions: Confusing pitch with loudness

concepts.name: Beats
concepts.description: Periodic variation in amplitude from similar frequencies
misconceptions: Confusing beat frequency with original frequencies

concepts.name: Doppler Effect
concepts.description: Frequency change due to relative motion
misconceptions: Thinking effect depends on distance, not velocity

concepts.name: Temperature and Thermal Energy
concepts.description: Relationship between temperature and particle motion
concepts.key_concept: Temperature as measure of average kinetic energy
misconceptions: Confusing temperature with thermal energy

concepts.name: Thermal Equilibrium
concepts.description: State where no net heat transfer occurs
misconceptions: Ignoring role of thermal conductivity

concepts.name: Specific Heat Capacity
concepts.description: Energy required to raise temperature of unit mass
practical_investigations: Determine specific heat capacity of materials
misconceptions: Confusing heat and temperature

concepts.name: Latent Heat
concepts.description: Energy involved in phase changes
practical_investigations: Analyze latent heat in phase changes
misconceptions: Not recognizing temperature remains constant during phase change

concepts.name: Heat Transfer Methods
concepts.description: Mechanisms of thermal energy transfer
misconceptions: Thinking heat rises (hot air rises)

concepts.name: Thermal Conductivity
concepts.description: Material property for heat transfer
misconceptions: Confusing insulation with inability to transfer heat

year11_modules.name: Module 4: Electricity and Magnetism
year11_modules.description: Study of electric and magnetic interactions

concepts.name: Electric Charge
concepts.description: Fundamental property of matter
misconceptions: Thinking charge is created rather than separated

concepts.name: Electric Force
concepts.description: Force between charged objects
practical_investigations: Verify relationship between charge, distance and force
misconceptions: Not recognizing inverse square relationship

concepts.name: Electric Field
concepts.description: Region of influence around charged objects
misconceptions: Thinking field lines are physical entities

concepts.name: Electric Potential Energy
concepts.description: Energy due to position in electric field
key_concepts: Work done moving charge in field
misconceptions: Confusing potential with field strength

concepts.name: Electric Current
concepts.description: Flow of electric charge
misconceptions: Thinking current is 'used up'

concepts.name: Ohm's Law
concepts.description: Relationship between current and voltage
misconceptions: Assuming all conductors obey Ohm's Law

concepts.name: Electrical Energy and Power
concepts.description: Rate of energy conversion in circuits
misconceptions: Confusing power with energy

concepts.name: Series and Parallel Circuits
concepts.description: Different ways to connect circuit components
misconceptions: Thinking current is divided equally in parallel

concepts.name: Magnetic Materials
concepts.description: Materials that produce or respond to magnetic fields
misconceptions: Thinking all metals are magnetic

concepts.name: Magnetic Fields
concepts.description: Region of influence around magnets or current
misconceptions: Confusing magnetic and electric fields

concepts.name: Magnetic Fields from Currents
concepts.description: Creation of magnetic fields by electric currents
practical_investigations: Map magnetic field around current-carrying conductors
misconceptions: Not recognizing right-hand rule relationships

concepts.name: Magnetization Process
concepts.description: How materials become magnetized
misconceptions: Thinking magnetization creates magnetic 'charge'

year12_modules.name: Module 5: Advanced Mechanics
year12_modules.description: Study of complex motion including projectile and circular motion

concepts.name: Projectile Model
concepts.description: Two-dimensional motion under constant gravity
key_assumptions: Constant vertical acceleration due to gravity
misconceptions: Thinking horizontal velocity changes

concepts.name: Projectile Analysis
concepts.description: Resolving motion into horizontal and vertical components
misconceptions: Connecting horizontal and vertical motions

concepts.name: Uniform Circular Motion
concepts.description: Motion in circle with constant speed
misconceptions: Thinking centripetal force is a separate force

concepts.name: Applications of Circular Motion
concepts.description: Real-world examples of circular motion
misconceptions: Confusing centripetal and centrifugal forces

concepts.name: Rotational Dynamics
concepts.description: Relationship between torque and rotation
key_concepts: Energy and work in rotational systems
misconceptions: Not accounting for rotational inertia

concepts.name: Newton's Law of Universal Gravitation
concepts.description: Force of attraction between masses
misconceptions: Confusing weight and mass

concepts.name: Orbital Motion
concepts.description: Motion of objects in orbit under gravitational influence
misconceptions: Thinking satellites need engines to stay in orbit

concepts.name: Kepler's Laws
concepts.description: Laws describing planetary motion
key_concepts: Elliptical orbits with sun at one focus
Relationship between period and semi-major axis
misconceptions: Thinking planetary orbits are perfectly circular

concepts.name: Gravitational Potential Energy
concepts.description: Energy due to position in gravitational field
key_equations: Total energy of orbiting body: U + K = -GMm/2r
misconceptions: Using simplified version (mgh) for orbital calculations

concepts.name: Escape Velocity
concepts.description: Minimum velocity to escape gravitational field
misconceptions: Thinking escape velocity depends on object mass

year12_modules.name: Module 6: Electromagnetism
year12_modules.description: Study of electric and magnetic interactions and their applications

concepts.name: Charged Particles in Electric Fields
concepts.description: Motion of charged particles due to electric forces
key_equations: Electric field between plates: E = V/d
Work done on charge: W = qV, W = qEd
misconceptions: Forgetting charge can be negative (direction)

concepts.name: Charged Particle Trajectories
concepts.description: Paths of charged particles in electric fields
concepts.key_comparison: Similar to projectile motion in gravitational fields
misconceptions: Neglecting initial velocity

concepts.name: Charged Particles in Magnetic Fields
concepts.description: Motion of charged particles due to magnetic forces
practical_investigations: Electron beam deflection in magnetic field
misconceptions: Forgetting force is perpendicular to velocity and field

concepts.name: Comparison of Field Interactions
concepts.description: Similarities and differences between interactions
key_comparisons: Charged particles in fields vs uniform circular motion
misconceptions: Assuming all fields behave the same way

concepts.name: Current-Carrying Conductors in Magnetic Fields
concepts.description: Force on conductors due to magnetic fields
key_concepts: Maximum force when current perpendicular to field
misconceptions: Forgetting vector nature of the interaction

concepts.name: Parallel Conductors
concepts.description: Forces between current-carrying wires
key_concepts: Relationship to SI definition of ampere
misconceptions: Not applying Newton's Third Law to the forces

concepts.name: Magnetic Flux
concepts.description: Measure of magnetic field passing through area
key_concepts: Flux changes due to field strength, area, or angle
misconceptions: Confusing flux with field strength

concepts.name: Faraday's Law
concepts.description: Induced EMF due to changing magnetic flux
misconceptions: Not understanding direction of induced current

concepts.name: Lenz's Law
concepts.description: Induced current opposes the change causing it
key_concepts: Conservation of energy in electromagnetic systems
misconceptions: Not relating to conservation of energy

concepts.name: Transformers
concepts.description: Devices that change AC voltage using induction
key_concepts: Ideal transformer vs. real transformer efficiency
misconceptions: Thinking transformers work with DC

concepts.name: DC Motors
concepts.description: Devices converting electrical to rotational energy
misconceptions: Not recognizing back EMF role

concepts.name: Generators
concepts.description: Devices converting mechanical to electrical energy
misconceptions: Confusing generator and motor principles

year12_modules.name: Module 7: The Nature of Light
year12_modules.description: Study of light properties and behavior from wave and particle perspectives

concepts.name: Maxwell's Electromagnetic Theory
concepts.description: Unified theory of electricity and magnetism
misconceptions: Not understanding the radical nature of unification

concepts.name: Electromagnetic Wave Production
concepts.description: Generation and propagation mechanisms
key_concepts: Oscillating electric and magnetic fields create waves
misconceptions: Thinking EM waves require a medium

concepts.name: Speed of Light
concepts.description: Fundamental constant of EM wave propagation
practical_investigations: Investigate methods to determine speed of light
misconceptions: Not recognizing role in time/distance measurement

concepts.name: Spectroscopy
concepts.description: Analysis of light spectra
misconceptions: Thinking all materials produce same spectrum types

concepts.name: Diffraction
concepts.description: Bending of light around obstacles/apertures
key_concepts: Evidence for wave nature of light
misconceptions: Thinking only occurs with certain sized apertures

concepts.name: Interference
concepts.description: Superposition of light waves
misconceptions: Not recognizing role of coherence

concepts.name: Polarization
concepts.description: Alignment of light wave oscillations
misconceptions: Thinking all light sources produce polarized light

concepts.name: Black Body Radiation
concepts.description: Radiation emitted by idealized perfect absorber
key_concepts: Classical physics failure to explain spectrum
misconceptions: Confusing with general thermal radiation

concepts.name: Photoelectric Effect
concepts.description: Electron emission from materials exposed to light
misconceptions: Thinking intensity affects electron energy

concepts.name: Einstein's Postulates
concepts.description: Fundamental principles of special relativity
misconceptions: Thinking postulates are obvious or intuitive

concepts.name: Time Dilation
concepts.description: Slowing of time in moving reference frames
misconceptions: Thinking effect is merely perceptual

concepts.name: Length Contraction
concepts.description: Shortening of objects in direction of motion
misconceptions: Thinking contraction occurs in all dimensions

concepts.name: Mass-Energy Equivalence
concepts.description: Relationship between mass and energy
misconceptions: Thinking matter 'converts to energy'

year12_modules.name: Module 8: From the Universe to the Atom
year12_modules.description: Study of astronomical events and atomic structure

concepts.name: Big Bang Theory
concepts.description: Theory of universe origin and early development
misconceptions: Thinking Big Bang was an explosion in space

concepts.name: Expanding Universe Evidence
concepts.description: Observational evidence for cosmic expansion
misconceptions: Thinking expansion has a center

concepts.name: Energy-Mass Equivalence in Stars
concepts.description: Application of E=mc² to stellar processes
key_concepts: Nuclear reactions as source of stellar energy
misconceptions: Not recognizing tiny mass defects create enormous energy

concepts.name: Stellar Spectra
concepts.description: Light analysis from stars
misconceptions: Thinking stars emit continuous spectra only

concepts.name: Hertzsprung-Russell Diagram
concepts.description: Stellar classification chart
misconceptions: Thinking all stars evolve along main sequence

concepts.name: Stellar Nucleosynthesis
concepts.description: Formation of elements in stars
key_processes: Advanced fusion in post-main sequence stars
misconceptions: Thinking all elements form in main sequence stars

concepts.name: Electron Discovery
concepts.description: Experimental evidence for electrons
misconceptions: Not understanding historical progression of discovery

concepts.name: Nuclear Model Development
concepts.description: Experimental evidence for nuclear structure
misconceptions: Not recognizing revolutionary nature of nuclear model

concepts.name: Atomic Model Limitations
concepts.description: Problems with classical atomic models
misconceptions: Thinking Bohr model is completely correct

concepts.name: Hydrogen Emission Spectrum
concepts.description: Distinct pattern of light emitted by hydrogen
misconceptions: Not recognizing pattern indicates energy levels

concepts.name: Quantized Energy Levels
concepts.description: Discrete energy states in atoms
misconceptions: Thinking electron energy varies continuously

concepts.name: De Broglie's Matter Waves
concepts.description: Wave properties of particles
misconceptions: Thinking wave-particle duality only applies to light

concepts.name: Radioactive Decay
concepts.description: Spontaneous decay of unstable nuclei
misconceptions: Not distinguishing between decay types

concepts.name: Half-Life
concepts.description: Time for half a sample to decay
misconceptions: Thinking half-life means half the atoms are gone forever

concepts.name: Nuclear Fission
concepts.description: Splitting of heavy nuclei
misconceptions: Confusing with fusion

concepts.name: Nuclear Fusion
concepts.description: Combining of light nuclei
misconceptions: Thinking fusion is easy to achieve on Earth

concepts.name: Standard Model
concepts.description: Framework classifying elementary particles
key_components: Quarks (up, down, charm, strange, top, bottom)
misconceptions: Thinking model is complete

learning_pathways.name: Waves to Quantum Pathway
learning_pathways.description: Sequential progression from classical to quantum physics

learning_pathways.name: Mathematical Skills Progression
learning_pathways.description: Development of key mathematical skills through physics applications

year11.name: Motion Analysis
year11.description: Track and analyze motion using digital technologies

year11.name: Collision Analysis
year11.description: Investigate momentum conservation in different collision types

year11.name: Wave Properties Investigation
year11.description: Analyze wave behavior in ripple tanks

year11.name: Standing Waves Investigation
year11.description: Generate and analyze standing waves on strings

year11.name: Specific Heat Capacity Determination
year11.description: Determine specific heat capacity of various materials

year11.name: Circuit Analysis
year11.description: Investigate current-voltage relationships in different circuit configurations

year11.name: Magnetic Field Mapping
year11.description: Map magnetic fields around magnets and current-carrying conductors

year12.name: Projectile Motion Analysis
year12.description: Validate relationships between initial velocity, angle and range

year12.name: Circular Motion Forces
year12.description: Analyze forces in uniform circular motion setups

year12.name: Transformer Analysis
year12.description: Analyze step-up and step-down transformer performance

year12.name: Light Interference
year12.description: Perform Young's double slit experiment and diffraction grating analysis

year12.name: Photoelectric Effect
year12.description: Investigate threshold frequency and work function

depth_studies.description: Extended investigations requiring minimum 15 hours in both Year 11 and Year 12
requirements: Must address multiple Working Scientifically skills
May be practical, secondary-sourced, or combination
Can be individual or collaborative projects

year11_opportunities.title: Motion Analysis in Sports
year11_opportunities.description: Analysis of motion principles in specific sports

year11_opportunities.title: Musical Instrument Physics
year11_opportunities.description: Design and construction of musical instruments based on wave principles

year11_opportunities.title: Home Energy Efficiency
year11_opportunities.description: Investigation of energy efficiency in buildings using thermodynamic principles

year11_opportunities.title: Alternative Energy Generation
year11_opportunities.description: Research and design of renewable energy generation systems

year11_opportunities.title: Magnetic Applications in Medicine
year11_opportunities.description: Investigation of magnetic technology applications in medical diagnostics and treatment

year12_opportunities.title: Satellite System Design
year12_opportunities.description: Planning a satellite mission with consideration of orbital mechanics

year12_opportunities.title: Electric Motor Optimization
year12_opportunities.description: Design and testing of electric motors for efficiency

year12_opportunities.title: Optical Instrument Design
year12_opportunities.description: Design and construction of optical instruments like telescopes

year12_opportunities.title: Particle Physics Research
year12_opportunities.description: Secondary-sourced investigation of current particle physics research

year12_opportunities.title: Stellar Evolution Models
year12_opportunities.description: Investigation of stellar life cycles and element formation

gateway_concepts.name: Vector Mathematics
gateway_concepts.teaching_strategy: Introduce early with practical physics applications rather than abstract mathematics

gateway_concepts.name: Newton's Laws of Motion
gateway_concepts.teaching_strategy: Use multiple representations (verbal, mathematical, graphical) to build understanding

gateway_concepts.name: Conservation Laws
gateway_concepts.teaching_strategy: Emphasize as unifying principles across all domains of physics

gateway_concepts.name: Wave Properties
gateway_concepts.teaching_strategy: Begin with tangible mechanical waves before moving to electromagnetic and quantum

gateway_concepts.name: Field Concept
gateway_concepts.teaching_strategy: Use visualizations and simulations to build spatial understanding of fields

gateway_concepts.name: Wave-Particle Duality
gateway_concepts.teaching_strategy: Present key experimental evidence that led to paradigm shift

sections.name: Multiple Choice
sections.focus: Knowledge and understanding across all modules

sections.name: Short Answer
sections.focus: Working Scientifically skills and Knowledge and Understanding

year11_sequence.focus: Kinematics and Dynamics with mathematical foundations

year12_sequence.focus: Nature of Light and From Universe to Atom
modules: Module 8: From the Universe to the Atom

metadata.implementation_notes: This knowledge graph is designed to support a cognitive learning approach with systematic building of prerequisite knowledge and skills
metadata.teaching_focus: Emphasizes gateway concepts and cross-module connections
